required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Novel Treatment to Boost Quit Attempts and Cessation Among Unmotivated Smokers
clinical_study.official_title: A Novel Treatment to Boost Quit Attempts and Cessation Among Unmotivated Smokers

brief_summary.textblock:
A sample of smokers who have no current plans to quit will be recruited for this study and randomized to one of two intervention conditions:
1. Practice Quit Attempt (PQA) aided by brief advice and self-help materials, or
2. PQA aided by advice and self-help materials plus nicotine replacement therapy (NRT).
This study will test whether adding free nicotine replacement therapy to brief advice to undertake a practice quit attempt will motivate more smokers to make a serious attempt to stop smoking than brief advice without NRT. All treatments and assessments will be delivered via telephone and mailing. The primary outcome of interest is the incidence of a serious attempt to permanently stop smoking made over a six-month study period.
Our specific hypotheses are as follows:
Hypothesis 1: Helping smokers to make a practice quit attempt aided by NRT will result in a higher incidence of making a serious effort to quit smoking permanently, compared to an aided practice quit attempt without NRT. We also expect provision of NRT will increase point prevalence abstinence at 6 month follow-up.
Hypothesis 2: This relationship between NRT-aided practice quit attempts and quit behaviors will be mediated by a) increased smoking related self efficacy, b) increased belief in the efficacy of NRT, c) fewer concerns about adverse events of NRT, d) increased social support for not smoking, and e) less withdrawal distress and craving during the practice quit attempt.

primary_outcome.measure: A Serious Quit Attempt in Which the Participant Intends to Permanently Stop Smoking
primary_outcome.time_frame: From study enrollment through six month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome was an attempt to quit smoking for good. To distinguish from a PQA, we specifically asked participants if they tried to quit smoking with the intent of quitting for good. Quit attempts were defined as any self-defined attempt to quit for good.

primary_outcome.measure: A 24 Hour Serious Quit Attempt in Which the Participant Intends to Permanently Stop Smoking
primary_outcome.time_frame: From study enrollment through six month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Serious quit attempt of >=24hrs, which fits the CDC's definition of a quit attempt.

secondary_outcome.measure: Abstinence From Cigarette Smoking, Where Abstinence is Defined as Self-report of Not Smoking at All for 7 Consecutive Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At any point during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Abstinence From Cigarette Smoking, Where Abstinence is Defined as Self-report of Not Smoking at All for 7 Consecutive Days

arm_group.description: Practice Quit Attempt plus Nicotine Replacement Therapy

intervention.intervention_name: Practice Quit Attempt plus nicotine lozenge

intervention.description: Practice Quit Attempts (PQA) message aided by brief advice and self-help materials

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current cigarette smoker of at least 10 cigarettes per day
- Interested in quitting at some time
- Not currently interested in quitting smoking
- Access to telephone (home or work) for 6 month study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Monthly cigar, pipe, or smokeless tobacco use
- Current pregnancy or breastfeeding
- Recent cardiovascular distress
- Phenylketonuria (PKU)
- Previous use of nicotine replacement therapy (gum, patch, lozenge, inhaler, or nasal spray)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 1/2009 - 2/2010 via the internet from an email database of potential enrollees provided by a market research firm. Eligible participants were mailed an informed consent and asked to return a signed copy if they wished to participate. Research staff then made calls to initiate formal study enrollment.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were randomized to treatment group in a 1:1 ratio using a random number generator with block randomization before research staff made calls to initiate formal study enrollment.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Plus Nicotine Replacement Therapy
group.description: This group received both the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA) and free nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) in the form of a lozenge for a 6-week treatment period.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Only
group.description: This group served as the control group and received only the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA).

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Plus Nicotine Replacement Therapy
group.description: This group received both the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA) and free nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) in the form of a lozenge for a 6-week treatment period.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Only
group.description: This group served as the control group and received only the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA).

outcome.title: A Serious Quit Attempt in Which the Participant Intends to Permanently Stop Smoking
outcome.description: The primary outcome was an attempt to quit smoking for good. To distinguish from a PQA, we specifically asked participants if they tried to quit smoking with the intent of quitting for good. Quit attempts were defined as any self-defined attempt to quit for good.
outcome.time_frame: From study enrollment through six month follow-up
outcome.population: All analyses were based on intent-to-treat approach; participants with missing data were assumed to have not made any quit attempts or quit.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Plus Nicotine Replacement Therapy
group.description: This group received both the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA) and free nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) in the form of a lozenge for a 6-week treatment period.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Only
group.description: This group served as the control group and received only the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA).

measure.title: A Serious Quit Attempt in Which the Participant Intends to Permanently Stop Smoking
measure.description: The primary outcome was an attempt to quit smoking for good. To distinguish from a PQA, we specifically asked participants if they tried to quit smoking with the intent of quitting for good. Quit attempts were defined as any self-defined attempt to quit for good.
measure.population: All analyses were based on intent-to-treat approach; participants with missing data were assumed to have not made any quit attempts or quit.

analysis.groups_desc: A logistic regression model was used to examine the primary hypothesis that NRT-enhanced PQAs would yield a higher rate of any ever-occurring quit attempt.

outcome.title: Abstinence From Cigarette Smoking, Where Abstinence is Defined as Self-report of Not Smoking at All for 7 Consecutive Days
outcome.time_frame: At any point during the study
outcome.population: All analyses were based on intent-to-treat approach; participants with missing data were assumed to have not made any quit attempts or quit.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Plus Nicotine Replacement Therapy
group.description: This group received both the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA) and free nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) in the form of a lozenge for a 6-week treatment period.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Only
group.description: This group served as the control group and received only the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA).

measure.title: Abstinence From Cigarette Smoking, Where Abstinence is Defined as Self-report of Not Smoking at All for 7 Consecutive Days
measure.population: All analyses were based on intent-to-treat approach; participants with missing data were assumed to have not made any quit attempts or quit.

analysis.groups_desc: A logistic regression model was used to examine the secondary hypothesis that NRT-enhanced PQAs would yield a higher rate of 7 days of abstinence at some point during the study.

outcome.title: A 24 Hour Serious Quit Attempt in Which the Participant Intends to Permanently Stop Smoking
outcome.description: Serious quit attempt of >=24hrs, which fits the CDC’s definition of a quit attempt.
outcome.time_frame: From study enrollment through six month follow-up
outcome.population: All analyses were based on intent-to-treat approach; participants with missing data were assumed to have not made any quit attempts or quit.

measure.title: A 24 Hour Serious Quit Attempt in Which the Participant Intends to Permanently Stop Smoking
measure.description: Serious quit attempt of >=24hrs, which fits the CDC’s definition of a quit attempt.
measure.population: All analyses were based on intent-to-treat approach; participants with missing data were assumed to have not made any quit attempts or quit.

analysis.groups_desc: A logistic regression model was used to examine the primary hypothesis that NRT-enhanced PQAs would yield a higher rate for the primary outcome of any 24hr quit attempt.

outcome.title: Abstinence From Cigarette Smoking, Where Abstinence is Defined as Self-report of Not Smoking at All for 7 Consecutive Days
outcome.population: All analyses were based on intent-to-treat approach; participants with missing data were assumed to have not made any quit attempts or quit.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Plus Nicotine Replacement Therapy
group.description: This group received both the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA) and free nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) in the form of a lozenge for a 6-week treatment period.

measure.title: Abstinence From Cigarette Smoking, Where Abstinence is Defined as Self-report of Not Smoking at All for 7 Consecutive Days
measure.population: All analyses were based on intent-to-treat approach; participants with missing data were assumed to have not made any quit attempts or quit.

analysis.groups_desc: A logistic regression model was used to examine the secondary hypothesis that NRT-enhanced PQAs would yield a higher rate for 7 days of abstinence at the six month follow-up.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected in the Practice Quit Attempt (PQA) + Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) group only. They were collected at every follow-up study visit, which included 5 time points over a 7.5 month (32 weeks) period.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Plus Nicotine Replacement Therapy
group.description: This group received both the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA) and free nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) in the form of a lozenge for a 6-week treatment period.

group.title: Practice Quit Attempt Only
group.description: This group served as the control group and received only the behavioral exercise of a practice quit attempt (PQA).

event.description: We were notified of the death of a participant from bladder cancer in the control group(PQA Only group, did not receive nicotine replacement therapy) by the participant's wife.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
